definition: to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician

sentences.english: Image CreditWhen reduced to begging in enclaves of humanity, the birds can often lose some of the wildness.
sentences.chinese: 在人类居住地乞食的鹤鸵渐渐的就会失去野性。

sentences.english: When he was too old to work, he had to beg for food to stay alive.
sentences.chinese: 当他老得不能干活的时候，只好乞食度日。

sentences.english: They are not about to raise their hands and say 'gimme.'
sentences.chinese: 他们不会举起双手向人乞食。
男人可以去乞食，女人就得去卖身。

sentences.english: Some have to pick up leftover food, others go around the streets to beg for food.
sentences.chinese: 有些人捡剩菜，有些则在街上乞食。

sentences.english: One day, Buddha and his disciples went to the city to beg for food.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，佛陀与比丘们入城乞食时。

sentences.english: The dog cocked its hind leg.
sentences.chinese: 那狗用两只后腿站着乞食。

definition: to go begging/to ask for alms
variant of 叫花子[jiao4 hua1 zi5]
to give in charity/to give alms (to the poor)
